title_sort: titus m. coan to walt whitman, 22 november 1880
title: Titus M. Coan to Walt Whitman, 22 November 1880
text: Titus M Coan's letterbooks sent $10 due from Century ClubTHE CENTURY109 EAST 15TH STREETNovember 22d 1880My Dear Sir, Please send us your "author's edition" of the Poems, for the library of this club, with bill for our Treasurer to pay next month. â€”I have been long on the look-out for a copy of the "Leaves of Grass," first edition, but have not yet succeeded in finding one. In any edition, first or last, I believe they are to have lasting remembrance. They are the American poetry which the Old World has been challenging us so long to produce; they "stir the blood like the sound of a trumpet." Faithfully yours,Titus M. Coan. Titus M. Coan to Walt Whitman, 22 November 1880
